page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY.
page.content: When the Roman occupation came to an end,about 420 A.D.,Scandinavian settlers first invaded,then colonized Holderness.Much later the Danes came and all eastern England became part of the "Danelaw".It is impossible to say when the first settlement appeared in Roos.In the Domesday Book,Roos had thirty acres of meadow,plough land, a church and a priest.William gave the land here to Drogo de Brevere who installed a vassal of his,called Fulco to oversee the land.After Drogo had killed his wife,William's niece, he fled the country and the land came into the hands of Odo,Count of Champagne.Odo plotted against William Rufus and left on a crusade.The village then passed to the Counts of Aumale.The village has changed little in character since Medieval times.
